title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When I change the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there is no children node listing displayed.
EB: I expect to see a children node listing when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
SR:
1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement.
2. Go to the data set editor and navigate to the data source page.
3. Change the data source to a different one.
4. Check if the children node listing is displayed.

Expected Result: The children node listing should be displayed after changing the data source.

Additional Steps:
5. Close the data set editor.
6. Reopen the data set editor and verify if the children node listing is still displayed.
